Name: Bhaskar_10
Title: Promoting Indian Craft: good exposure to craftsman and customers
Review: Visited on 28th December 2022Entrance Fee is INR 60/- per adult and INR 20/- per childThere was a theme based exhibition going on in ShilpaRaman till 31-Dec'22 and the crafts on display included kalamkari, Orissa Ikat, Gujarat Patola, Macrame from Bengal, Wood Craft, Bhagalpuri, Indore/Maheshwars, Leather products amongs many others.The quality of products on display showcased the rich and vivid talent of the crafts of India and prices ranged from couple of thousand to more than hundred tousand depending of the products.The visitors included mostly families while some youngters (seemingly college students) also visited in groups and interacted with teh craft-people.Very well designated place with paid parking and is a must viist while in Hyderabad.The only challange is the exit gate of the parking being too far, the visitors have to walk into teh parking to get into their vehicle and many could be seen walking along the incoming vehicle which is dangerous. If the management can look into a viable solution it will be appreciated.

Name: Vaishnavi_g
Title: Very interesting place for those who love culture and heritage
Review: If you are renovating your house and interested in art collection this is a good place to visit. From sarees, shawls, wooden crafts, ethnic fashion wears, traditional painting and crafts you get them all here. You have museums and village settings you can enjoy.

Name: Mayank G
Title: Lovely Place to shopping and enjoy
Review: We visited this place with minimum expectation but it turned out one of the best place to visit, shopping, enjoying and hang out with family and friends . You will find her art, culture, music and various handlooms . Lovely place

Name: Gurus49
Title: Artistic Place
Review: A quaint place that exhibits local artisans and their wares. The place is perfect to buy rustic items.

Name: Ranjan Alu
Title: Great place
Review: Good place , love to visit again and again , thank to team who have planned this project , love the culture program , ai request everyone should visit once .

Name: Suman@620
Title: Anniversary celebrated place
Review: We celebrate our 15th Wedding anniversary at that place.me & my wife had great time with shopping &food stall.thr r lot of hand craft meterial to purchase with reasonable price.

Name: Fairy
Title: Indian Ethnic Crafts Village
Review: Shilparamam is an Indian ethnic crafts village. A good place to spend a leisurely evening and fulfil your desire of shop till you drop, on Indian ethnic handicrafts. They have a large display and sale of handicrafts from artisans from across the country. One can find handmade pottery, metal craftwork, ethnic outfits, sarees from Banaras and other South Indian states, handbags from Gujarat, embroidered patchwork runners and cushions, crochet outfits and bags and lots more. The shopkeepers don’t have any fixed rates, and there is a lot of bargaining going around the shops, which makes one feel if they have actually paid a reasonable price. One thing one must keep in mind here while purchasing is that these artisans don’t earn much sitting here all year long. We must be reasonable while bargaining with them. Most times they do quote random exorbitant prices, which is not fair too. So it is ultimately at the customers’ discretion if they want to buy it or not. Just compare prices in other stall before making a purchase. The place is mostly well maintained, and one can move around leisurely shopping and enjoying the village themed ambience. There are lot of food stalls, but we have never tried any of those as the hygiene is questionable at the stalls. The food stalls in particular are not maintained very well. They are just filthy. You may choose to visit this place in the evening to avoid the sun and heat, as the place is sprawling and expansive and totally open to air. On Sundays they have some beautiful ethnic performances in their open air amphi theatre, which are a treat. It is truly refreshing to see these performances to actually enjoy the true milieu.

Name: TravelbuggIndia
Title: Beautiful evening chilling spot
Review: Shilparamam is a cultural park cum shopping area for experiencing different cultures of India and to shop handicraft products from the different corners of India. It has an entry ticket and it is a fun place to roam around in the evening.

Name: Abhishek S
Title: Handlooms and Shopping
Review: This place is one of the greatest attractions specially women who love shopping.From apparels to furniture all you can find here that to ethnic and cultural.It also has a man made lake for boating and a waterfall.You can take photos here.It also has good options for snacks

Name: richagoel15
Title: nothing exclusive but good stuff
Review: It is a nice place with a traditional feeling. The food within the campus is quite affordable. If you have been to delhi hatt then this will be a disappointment, but still it is worth a visit. There are mini exhibitions going on inside. you can get mehandi on your hands and there is a small pond inside too.

Name: Ken W
Title: Tourist trap..not worth the time
Review: We were pretty disappointed with this place.  We'd expected more in terms of seeing local handicrafts being made, together with other cultural things of interest e.g. dance.The website describing the place really bigs it up, and our experience was not as expected.Bottom line is if you want to be hassled by guys selling pashminas, then maybe this is for you.

Name: shirin t
Title: Beautiful in a way that serves Indian culture
Review: A superbly beautiful place offer Indian culture in the shape of handcrafted stuff, Indian cultural attires, show pieces for your drawing rooms, indianized shoes, and a walkthrough which you are going to fall in love with. Local market and end your visit with the street food.

Name: OPM
Title: Shilparamam
Review: A nice collection of handiwork of Indian Artisans with a vast variety of clothes, ornaments, wooden work and also Art and Crafts items all across the country.

Name: importedinteriors
Title: Not what it used to be
Review: Have visited them every time I was in Hyderabad.  I noticed that the crowds have tinned out, the vendors and the ships have been reduced and the quality of handicrafts have declined.  The shopkeeper complained about the lack of business.

Name: Jajabor
Title: Hyderabadi Dilli Haat
Review: If you have been to the famous Dilli Haat next to the INA metro station, New Delhi (near Safdurjung), you may want to skip this one. This is a younger brother of the version in the capital....with pretty much the same things on offer, albeit in lesser variety. The food stalls are very average and don't offer much.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Must visit arts and craft centre
Review: Excellent arts and crafts village with lots of options to explore starting from Village museum to open air sculpture park and shops selling handicraft items. There is also boating facility for adults and kids and a nice food court. With ample parking space, you can plan a full day visit to this place

Name: jainms
Title: Very nice
Review: Good maintenance can see and culture is very well maintained too. Evening the best time to visit here.

Name: Soumyajit Saha
Title: Shilparamam Cultural Centre
Review: Shilparamam Cultural Centre is located in Hyderabad in India. It is a cultural institution where many types arts are perfomed.

Name: sunil
Title: A  village  in the heart of the city
Review: It gives a feel as if we are in a typical village environment with all the greenery and various handcrafts.Boatride is an added attraction and there are markets which sell antiques.

Name: Ram Mohan
Title: Good collection of artifacts and clothes
Review: Shilparamam has been one of Hyderabad’s Popular Landmarks for almost 20 years. Starting from designer home decor stuff made from clay to handloom clothes , you won’t be disappointed with the range available. Easily accessible from anywhere in the city. Metro rail has made it even more convenient to reach this place. Parking is also not an issue . Cultural programs are conducted at the open air auditorium in the premises

Name: Shalini N
Title: Good for shopping
Review: Small handicrafts village with village setups and shops selling handicrafts and other local artworks.. go in the evenings.. Metro Station is nearby

Name: MyNameIs Shiva
Title: Good place to know about Culture.
Review: A place Where we can get some knowledge on Indian Tradition and Culture.Beautiful location in Hyderabad and a must watchable place.If you want to spend good time with Your family this is the place.

Name: Wilayat
Title: Art & craft walk
Review: Shilparamam Arts and Crafts village is a tribute to the cultural legacy of India. The primary aim of this establishment is to foster, restore and help flourish the culture of India's glorious past

Name: Santoso Jaeri
Title: Great traditional place
Review: This is one of traditional cultural place should be visited. There are dance, souvenir and also traditional food such as Dosa and Indian tea.

Name: Najiya Rinaf
Title: Definitely the Kaleidoscope of India
Review: Have you ever been to 'Shilparamam' located in Madhapur, Hyderabad? Many of you would have definitely made a visit to this arts & crafts village. This was my second time here and I was literally lost in their exclusive Indian pottery and incredible porcelain works during my search for ethnic home decors. No wonder it is renowned as the kaleidoscope of India's varied color tones, multi-culture, adorable diversity, and artistic talent.

Name: Sudhir K
Title: Great place for shopping local art/stuffs and hangout
Review: Its a lovely place for shopping ethnic wear, handicraft, etc. Also there are good options for food. There is a boating facility within the campus. Once there was bullock cart ride option also. On some special days, there is exhibition or musical festival and one can enjoy it free. For example on 2nd October there was a exhibition on Mahatma Gandhi and there was a musical concert of classical music/dance. Day time it might be hot in summer, best to go in evening. There is rock garden at back side, which is also interesting to see.

Name: chaithu k
Title: Cultural society
Review: It is an excellent view point. There has memories of our old traditions. And it is good place for enjoying with family or friends. Scluputres are describing how our past people lived in that time. Hope that every one will enjoy the place...

Name: Santosh K
Title: Good place
Review: This is a must visit to see very old culture and very nicely maintained by their staff.So definitely recommended.

Name: Sheetal S
Title: art and culture of gone by days
Review: a nice place to visit and spend 2-3 hours. Buy the 50 rs ticket at counter. Many high priced shops are here so good negotiating is a must. Must visit the museums inside.Worth a visit.

Name: Polavarapu
Title: Silparamam
Review: Silparamam is a park,, with shopping all traditional and cultural heritage, built by government to develop traditional heritage, it's a nice place,,,

Name: NIL_MODI
Title: Arts and Crafts Village
Review: Shilparamam Cultural Society is a arts and crafts village. Its a place of shopping along with fun. Entry is chargeable.

Name: Suneela K
Title: Crafts village
Review: It is an enlightening experience of the rural life in India. Very neatly maintained. Good place to spend time with family and children. The kids love the open place. Very relaxing with all the greenery around. Lots of options to eat at reasonable cost. Lot of stalls to buy handicrafts. Well worth visiting multiple times.

Name: Debasis
Title: Cultural place
Review: This is a good place for family day outing in the hi-tech City area. Well connected by metro trains from anywhere within Hyderabad.Lots of shopping options.Boating is available.Overall a decent place.

Name: abrahamsuji
Title: Craft extravaganza
Review: Easy access. Must visit. Artisans display and sell their products themselves with minimal profit. Got loads of items from there.

Name: CountlessFootprints
Title: Nice place for a stroll and shopping for handicrafts
Review: It's a really big area with ample amount of walking space. Series of stalls selling handicrafts items are located here from fragile cutleries to hand designed sarees, There is an amphitheatre which is a performance area for folks artists - You'll love it if you are into folk music. They have a small lake where boating is allowed till ~6pm and a foodcourt area if you'd like to sip a cup of hot coffee or grab a quick meal.

Name: Pallabi Das
Title: Peaceful Blowing Summer Evening Visit
Review: I went their 2 times . you can enjoy a lot here . You can capture so many memories also. It's fun for children also.

Name: jainms
Title: Cultural city
Review: Very good place & must to visit. we can find hand made cloths, old tradition & also cultural activities in the evening times.

Name: JCDas
Title: Great place to see variety of craftsmen with their work.
Review: Wonderful initiative and well spacious layout of variety of craftsmen from all over India. But be careful regarding pricing of the items. What I found is they initially announce high price and the genuine price may be 50% or below. Thus there might be a feeling of getting cheated. But definitely a good place to buy handicraft and to enjoy cultural programs also.

Name: ShaanRoy
Title: Expensive to shop around
Review: its basically a market where businessmen from different states have set up their shops to sell their goods at a very expensive price. Avoid purchasing stuff which you will get at one third the price in the local market outside. The sellers from the north have a good collection of antique lookalikes but you have to bargain hard to get a good deal. Many shops accept cards as payment option. Parking is available in the basement for 30/- for four wheelers and 20/- for two wheelers. Entry fee is 50/-. Its a big area and will take half a day to roam around. Visit during the evening to avoid heat. There is a boating facility inside the lake and there is a stage where daily shows happen in the evening (dance performance etc. ) There are fast food stalls inside the complex. Not sure if the wash rooms are clean.

Name: Raja
Title: Beautiful Crafts and Arts
Review: If in Hyderabad, a visit to Shilparamam is highly recommended. The arts and crafts in this village are a tribute to the cultural heritage of India.Artists from all over the country display their masterful collections which are reasonably priced.The village museum, Rock garden, Sculpture park are some of the main attractions. Great place to visit, shop and enjoy your day (keep aside at least half a day for this place). There are cultural presentations along with a good cafe to relax.

Name: Alok Kumar Singh
Title: Nice place to shop
Review: A good place to shop, but yeah they charge a bit more, if you know local language bits even better or else if u can get to get discount it's worth... U will love it at night...

Name: Reena
Title: Amazing variety, unique items
Review: I visited this place because I'd heard a lot about it. I was overwhelmed by the variety found here. If it wasn't for baggage limitation, I would've gone crazy shopping here. I'll be definitely coming back for more!

Name: Eddie P
Title: GREAT SHOPPING!!!
Review: I love this spot, sort of an outside shopping market with stalls.  I purchase vest for my sons and I.  It is a busy place, but yet quiet and relaxing.

Name: drdesai
Title: Definitely a must place for Cotton ikkat
Review: Handicraft village with stalls selling clothing, necklaces, furniture and all local items. There is an open air amphitheatre and Best out of waste garden. Since we visited in late evening we did not explore the whole area.

Name: Nagesh Eco Ventures
Title: Best for Shopping with family
Review: Cool outing place with shopping and other activities, Best for Shopping with family. very reasonable rates

Name: Pijush Mukherjee
Title: Park of Craft & Art
Review: The place of Craft & Art - Really a very good place for visitors .  Nice place to visit with family .

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: art and crafts
Review: This is a big place and audio functions happens inside this and also there is a art and craft exhibition and sale over here

Name: Abhilash K
Title: Nice place
Review: This is one of the best place in the Hyderabad. I want to visit here again. Me and my friends enjoyed a lot here.

Name: Vanessa H
Title: Nice market
Review: Really nice market, lots of pushy vendors but also a lot of great stuff. Go here in the evening with all the lights and more crowds which means you can walk around a little bit more relaxed.

Name: Debasis
Title: Family time
Review: Very nice place, quality time spent with family and friends...lot of shopping options...enjoyed the cultural activities also.

Name: Harisha C
Title: Cultural heritage
Review: Best place which reminds us our village in the city. Lot of stalls to buy traditional clothes and accessories. Good prices available for bargainers. Nice place to hangout with friends and family.

Name: Anant K
Title: Wonderful place
Review: This is the place for everyone to visit a very amazing place and beautiful place too visit in Hyderabad city

Name: Oxymoronish
Title: Great place to shop and stroll
Review: Delightful place to shop for quirky things and souvenirs. I picked up some amazing linen saris here. Of course, there's a lot of bargaining involved. And when we went they had a cultural program going on with dance shows from all over India. It was amazing. They also have bullock cart rides and a food court. Definitely recommend this place.

Name: sree143in
Title: Culturel park
Review: This is a best place of different types of cultural activities can perform a nice place for activitis

Name: Anilkumar
Title: The place where u get all the handicrafts
Review: Simply superbRight in the centre of the city & next to kfc 😋.A place where u get the handicrafts,ethnic wears and u can see some pets alsoFully rabbits BTW u will get a chance for boating also.

Name: karthikakavya
Title: Village background
Review: lots of performances takes place here and we can get lots of different types of art articles clothes and many more accessories for ladies and few traditional not few but more traditional artistic things . also food and charts are available and the prices are ok not much bargain but ok overall its a good site view place

Name: Harish M
Title: Good and huge.
Review: It’s good to visit shilparaman, Hyderabad. It is very big in size and have lot of shops for shopaholic from novelties to garments to daily use objects of different cultures across the country.

Name: Madhavi
Title: Country atmosphere in the heart of the city
Review: A must visit for everyone visiting Hyderabad. The craft village of Shilparamam has something for all ages. Good food, handicraft shopping, fun rides and cultural programs.

Name: siva j
Title: Must visit to know the Indian village culture and shop for best handlooms
Review: Shilparamam has the Indian village culture related set up, depicting most of the handi crafts of villages.Good collection of handlooms avaialable for woman, many decorative items available for shopping.Boating also available, can have a reacreation trip for a day, spending time in green park, eat, shop and relax.

Name: thiru_sri3
Title: An excellent showcase of handicrafts
Review: There were no special programs when I visited but it was still worth the visit; it showcases culture and craft in a wonderful manner. being there on a evening made it all the more pleasant. It truly resembles an Indian village (specifically an Andhra/Telangana one). It is hard not to like this place.

Name: YatriForever
Title: Showcase of traditional art.
Review: Located in the hi-tech area of the city, Shilparamam houses and hosts so many fairs of handicrafts, sculptures and thisands of artifacts. The place is lively, so much to see and observe. We bought chairs made of jute, we are very pleased with them. Some small contribution to preserve our traditional art ! Absolutely worth a visit. There's a small entry fee. Visiting the official website of Shilparamam helps to prepare the plan.

Name: Prasad
Title: Good Place to see
Review: Visited Shilparamam cultural society last time. It is intended time.  Some cultural dance programs are happening at the time.  Happy to see that and many things are there for shopping. Prices are little bit heavy.

Name: UniQhu
Title: Best shopping place for Handicrafts and Pashminas
Review: A very good place near Hi-Tech city for shopping exclusive Indian handicrafts, Jewelry and Pashmina scarves.  This place has the feel of Indian Villages. Visit during evenings to experience the best of this place. For people working in Hi-tech city, this place is very close by to have a quick shopping break. For foreign tourists , this place is a one stop shopping spot for Indian handicrafts.Note : Take a quick bullock cart ride available inside here to add a fun experience in your list of activities.I take a lot of my clients here to buy Pashmina's and they are very happy with the best deals they get here.

Name: shashi_shaw
Title: Explore arts and culture
Review: It's a nice place to be with friends and family. You can find a lot of handicrafts, wood work, decor items and even some nice paintings for your living room.It's well maintained and very has a variety of shops and decors. You can find various types of clothes from different regions of India (don't forget to bargain - if you are buying anything)There is an entry fee which helps makes it not so crowded, and you get a chance to explore.

Name: Mohit Agrawal
Title: Good shoping spot withing city
Review: Place will give you a feel of village an the heart of a metro city.They have got a village museum also which is worth watching. A good shopping place for art and craft stuff.

Name: Natesh Reddy
Title: Shilparamam Hi-tech city Hyderabad
Review: Today visited shilparamam,it is located at Hi-tech city madhapur area. Near to JNTU university.i would like to show the village replica to my daughter and shilparamam is a right place. You can see exact village culture there.how to make mud pots and village people living style. different village festival events. Ancient wearing cloths and it will  sale small shops. Village manufactured handlooms etc..water boating,y you can watch Indian traditional dance Bharat Natyam at 6pm onwards.Many foreigners visit this place regularly because it is near to Hi-tech city. Most of them are different companies clients accompanying with their local staff.

Name: KajariMitra
Title: Excellent Range of Indian handicrafts & textiles
Review: This is Hyderabad's Delhi Haat and has many improvements. The stalls are well stocked with merchandise from all over India. The South Indian crafts were off course in plenty and I was able to discover a new form of tribal art - the Cherial of Telangana. The Food stalls were a bit limited but they were selling excellent local brewed tea for a very reasonable rate.The landscape was excellent-very well designed incorporating the natural rocks & shrubs of the area. The washrooms were surprisingly clean & manned by a personnel which helped as some areas were very quiet and not very busy.This place is easily accessible as it is close to the Centre of the newer parts of Hyderabad. so, excellent experience and great shopping!

Name: MUKKU S M R S
Title: silparamam
Review: Good place to buy different kinds of handicraft items in one place and one of the good place to visit in Hyderabad.

Name: aks4477
Title: Visit to shilparamam
Review: Good place to buy different kinds of handicraft from different states of India. Bullock cart ride is also available. Good sculptures, good for 3-4 hours visit.

Name: manikantaa
Title: Nice
Review: Very nice place in this hand crafted things are very interested and I visited last month with my family and friends

Name: Dr. Santosh Raut
Title: Nice experience
Review: Nice experience with entire family, one of the good place to visit in Hyderabad, recommended for once visit

Name: Pearl T
Title: A variety of crafts and entertainment
Review: Saw a variety of crafts from different parts of India, folk dance performances and rode an ox-drawn cart. Good way to see a range of arts and crafts in one location.  Went late afternoon-early evening to avoid daytime heat.

Name: Jayashree G
Title: Arts of the nation in one collective
Review: Be prepared to traverse through the Arts and Crafts exhibits at Shilparamam.  You need at least 1 hour to browse through and more if you are keen to buy stuff.  Madhubani paintings, Kakamkari prints, Sahranpur wood crafts, Odishi Patachitra, Kashmiri woollen items, Gujarati Katha work sling bags and more, Tanjore paintings, Artists offering to draw potraits, Lucknavi Chikankari, Mehendi artists, Ikkat designs, eateries including the famous Gokul Chats are some noteworthy  attractions here.Reasonably priced, Shilparamam is a great way to experience the extensively diverse and rich culture of our motherland.  Only wish that the shopkeepers used an alternative to the plastic carry bags that are readily given.

Name: LAL KISHORE K
Title: SHILPARAMAM -ARTISANS  VILLAGE IN THE CITY
Review: Thia is a ''must visit '' place for those who love artistic works of rural artisans of India particularly from Andhrapradesh and Telangana states.You will find more than 300 shops selling art works of various types,made from wood, metals etc. and also variety of clothes.This is a place to be visited by tourists, particularly foreigners,who wish to take gifts for their friends and relatives in their native country.Some of the artwork pieces are really impressive.There is entry ticket for adults.There is also boat ride for recreation and some eateries to take snacks.It takes about 2 to 4 hours to complete the visit.It is located centrally in the city of Hyderabad .Evenings will be pleasant to while away time and do some shopping

Name: kennice2016
Title: A good place to relax
Review: This place is culturally awesome, highlighting the touch of rural life in India and very refreshing for nature lovers. There is always an entertaining activity happening here. One full day is also too hectic for the fun and entertainment. many foreigners prefer this place for their shopping. The bargaining range is not very wide.

Name: Chetu1087
Title: Nice place shopping addicts
Review: It is a nice place to have look at variety of products specially clothes. Other attractions includes wooden and ceramic articles.

Name: PGNJ10
Title: Nice outdoor place for the evening
Review: By Indian standards, this is a pretty nice place to visit., Highlights1. Can buy handicrafts directly from artisans. As other reviewers have mentioned, bargain well. You can get stuff at 50% of the first quote. It will be harder for non-Indians and north Indians to bargain. So go with someone local if you plan to purchase something expensive. 2. Cultural shows in the evening are interesting. You cannot expect Cirque Du Soleil in $1 ticket. There is a decent effort to manage mosquitoes. Expect few bites if you are not fully covered.3. Boating can be fun for someone who has never done boating. Frequent travellers to USA and Europe may find it childish though. Water can be smelly and again full of mosquitoes. 4. Provides some trees and green environment in the concrete jungle. So you can walk around if the weather is good. Negatives:]1. Street dogs roam around free. 2. Kids are plucking flowers despite warning signs.3. Mosquitoes

Name: dipali
Title: Handicrafts village with array of traditional regional artifacts
Review: This craft village with all kind of handicrafts and art work is located in hitech city area of Hyderabad. This place is run by state government and attracts huge number of visitors especially on the weekends. During the last month of the year December  season, different cultural events like mytholigical plays, dance programs, mono actions etc are also organized in this place. It has variety of stalls for the crafts made from different parts of the country. These hand made crafts range from ornaments, clothes, pingani ware, pearls, bangles, foot ware, handbags, wooden toys etc. One can shop something for your house or some traditional Indian fabric and intricate work then Shilparamam is a good place to go. Lots of stalls selling local crafts and clothing.  If anybody wants to buy fabrics,clothes,artwork, scarves , pottery or ironwork. Indeed it's a good place to shop,beautiful shops and merchandise from across India. There is also a small  garden available for kids, boating, best out of waste sculptures and food. Its a very colourful place. Do buy whatever you like but don't forget to bargain well. These items are available at very reasonable price and bargaining is expected here, so be sure to bargain at every stall. There is also a food court available selling snacks, cold drinks and ice creams inside Shilparamam if you plan to munch during your visit.  There is also a small village museum made up of wax sculptures of different professionals in village. Kids can enjoy Rajasthani puppet show. State government also started night bazar here so that, people can do the shopping during night also. Mehindi (henna) stalls are available where in the girls lay different mehindi designs for payment. This is a very good place for women shopping. Plenty of parking is available in newly constructed basement parking.Only thing is if you are outsider then be careful as the shopkeeper would try to fool you with the pricing of different things.

Name: mighty7886
Title: A celebration of handloom culture
Review: The place provides an exhibition of all the hand-loom items and lush green paths around it. A must visit.

Name: pvrkaushik
Title: Nice place to spend an evening
Review: This place has lots of greenery and themed places... Also rock garden similar to Chandigarh. Don't miss this place

Name: Aqua L
Title: Evening Retreat for Family
Review: A place for curios from around India. Open spaces for kids,  snacks are available. Night market is lean, though advertised

Name: Shridhar93
Title: Must try
Review: Shilparamam is supposed to have Crafts Museum, Cultural Museum, Art Gallery & Library, Multi-purpose Auditorium, Common Facility Workshops and Research & Design Centre along with accommodation facilities for artists and visitors..

Name: Trending T
Title: Night bazaar
Review: This place is famous for indian traditional clothes and it has night bazaar where you can buy lot of handloom made things and can make your time pass.

Name: rockzzM77
Title: Amazing Place
Review: I visited here with my sister and her husband, we really like this theme park, the park was nicely maintained, If you are in Hyderabad must go here.

Name: Lavesh G
Title: Extremely Average market, Good gardens....!!!
Review: U are in for a huge disappointment if you have been to places like the the Delhi Haat, the CIE etc...This place does not have anything to attract you. The only saving grace are the gardens where you can probably relax if you wish to do that kind of stuff

Name: GreenCarpet11
Title: Essence of India
Review: Lights up and the village industries come alive here, even the earth becomes fragrant with the culture of India.It brings up to your mind a myriad images from your past and a happiness that you can grasp no more.Yet, those beautifully crafted items that gleam around your eyes were crafted with hard working hands to earn a few pennies more to feed those who depend on them for a living. Mind you, when lights are out and when daylight streams in too there is a lot to see . The India still lives under the blazing sun or the winter cold , the hand made items, the subtly painted figures dance and prance about on the vases and urns.You run into very beautifully bent arches fitted with lights and flocks grazing all time by the riverside, an idyllic site from greeting cards, very old houses with thick walls which are disappearing today, handmade bags, Rajasthani arts and crafts, bangles and chains and trinkets, wrought iron stuff, jewel boxes, Kashmir carpets, pure cotton sarees, terra cota  and endless little things one would enjoy.It is open everyday. There are museums and parks where you can stroll about. A small theater for entertainment shows typically Indian.   Entry fee is minimal.Enjoy the evenings.Do not litter.

Name: kurukuntla raviteja
Title: Shilparamam
Review: Shilpa Raman is located in Hyderabad near  hi tech city kondapur there is available hand made crafts it is good place to shipping and said seen there is many gifts shops will available  we have to shop at night because it is too beautiful comfortable with everyone

Name: Mohan
Title: Full of enjoyment
Review: At this place we can find lot of handmade products and a beautiful village experience and we can find idols with scrap

Name: Relax08134827658
Title: Good Place for Local Shopping
Review: Good place if you plan to buy handicrafts or other small souvenirs from your trip.However,i must advice to bargain hard.As some of the visitors are foreigners,they tend to inflate prices and charge you more.Buy at 80% of what they quote

Name: gabrial03330
Title: One of the best place if culture and hand crafted items
Review: There you can have N number of hand beautiful crafted items with good price which reflects the culture of the place.

Name: 73prashantha
Title: Cultural site.
Review: They have a lot of handicrafts and reflect telangana culture.their camel and bull rides are awesome. must visit in hyderabad

Name: Camper22259549037
Title: Traditional shopping
Review: I like the atmosphere there with alot of shops and hand made sculptures and alot of art.. It's very attractive in the days of Sankranti with more decorative things and especially bullock cart😍

Name: deepa v
Title: Shilparamam
Review: One of the famous places in Hyd.Located in the hi-tech city.. the place has many shopping outlets right from clothes to toys to paintings to food stalls and it even hosts some cultural events during festival times. Must visit in Hyd.

Name: Kirikera
Title: A must see if you are in the area
Review: As this was behind Hotel Trident (where I was staying), decided to visit it. Lot of ethnic wear. Nice food too. There was a Bharatnatyam performance too that I saw. Do no miss if you are in the vicinity.

Name: NeerajSharma
Title: Great place to buy ethnics
Review: if you want to buy ethnics and other sort of cultural stuff then this place is worth to visit but you need to be a good negotiator else you may feel as robbed later , washrooms are pathetic, food canteen in the area isn't great and they don't maintain hygiene.

Name: Akhil P
Title: Decent place for cultural events
Review: It is good for the all cultural lovers to spend decent amount of time with parents and with their children's all types of classic dances performed well

Name: Khyati
Title: Its good to visit once
Review: This place is good to see and buy art and handicraft items.. it is crowded .. it has number of stalls with different items..

Name: Uma
Title: Ok to visit once
Review: We went on a weekend in the eve. Completely packed. Won't advise to buy sarees. Could find metal jewelleries, bedsheets. Decors, jute bags.. Worth to visit once..

Name: RaF
Title: Misleading Tourists, waste of time.
Review: I visited this place  in the late afternoon. Shopkeepers  are either sleeping  or don't want to attend to  the customers. You can  find this kind of  place  in any village  or temple  fairs. Food  facilities  inside  Shilparam  is unnhygeinic.

Name: Narendra B
Title: Shilparamam
Review: This is added tourist attraction for tourist for local and villege culture of telangana.Hand made handicrafts sold here.It is also picnic spot surrounded by number of green treees
